DataElement.preferredName: Deep Vein Thrombosis Prevention Therapy Other Quantity Acetylsalicylic Acid Received Dose
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the dose the patient received of aspirin as prophylactic treatment for deep vein thrombosis.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Deep Vein Thrombosis Prevention Therapy Other Quantity Acetylsalicylic Acid Received
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the action of having received the administration of an unspecified dosage quantity of aspirin, an orally administered non-steroidal antiinflammatory agent know to decrease synthesis of prostaglandin, platelet aggregation, and inflammation, to prevent the formation of blood clots in the deep veins of the extremities.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A blood clot (thrombus) in a deep vein in the thigh or leg.:An attempt to prevent disease.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: A blood clot in a deep vein, predominantly in the lower extremity, but may include the pelvis or upper extremity.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Property.preferredDefinition: An orally administered non-steroidal antiinflammatory agent that inhibits cyclooxygenase synthesis of prostaglandin, preventing the formation of platelet aggregation and inflammation. It has analgesic and antipyretic properties. (NCI04):Not otherwise specified.:Quantity; how much there is of something that you can measure.:Received; taken, gotten, or acquired.

Concepts.definition: An orally administered non-steroidal antiinflammatory agent. Acetylsalicylic acid binds to and acetylates serine residues in cyclooxygenases, resulting in decreased synthesis of prostaglandin, platelet aggregation, and inflammation. This agent exhibits analgesic, antipyretic, and anticoagulant properties.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.
To take, accept, or get something offered.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The amount of medicine taken, or radiation given, at one time.

Concepts.definition: A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.

ReferenceDocuments.description: If other dose of Aspirin given, specify dose
